channel.title: Comments on: Plotting raster data from Natural Earth

item.title: By: SH
item.dc:creator: SH
item.description: When I modify the code as set view 90,90,1.75 instead of the original one set view 67,113,1.75 , plotting the Eastern Hemisphere becomes somehow strange... It seems that the range of 90 < x < 180 is plotted reversely while 0 < x < 90 is not. I'm using Version 5.0 patchlevel 3.
item.content:encoded:
When I modify the code as
set view 90,90,1.75
instead of the original one
set view 67,113,1.75
, plotting the Eastern Hemisphere becomes somehow strange…
It seems that the range of 90 < x < 180 is plotted reversely while 0 < x < 90 is not.
I'm using Version 5.0 patchlevel 3.

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.content:encoded:
Ah, cool. Here is the corresponding result after adding your settings.

Fig. 3 Natural Earth II shaded relief and water plot of the world. (code to produce this figure, data)

item.title: By: JJ
item.dc:creator: JJ
item.content:encoded:
In order to properly project the 3D figure, you need to change the terminal size to be equal (for example ‘350,350’), and to add the following:

set view equal xyz
set xyplane relative 0.0
